application

Class SimonSays

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.SimonSays

  • public class SimonSays
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages all of the Simon Says Game. It will create a starting sequence, and check the sequence that the user inputs to check if correct. It will end the game when needed, and keep track of variables such as the amount of turns.
    Author:
    Jessica Lee, Shannon Park, Robert Lou, Amy Liu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sequence 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimonSays()
      This is a constructor to create the SimonSays Object It sets the index to zero, creates arrayList for sequence, and sets GameOn to false.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToSequence()
      This mutator method will add a random color (r, g, y, b) to the sequence
      boolean checkSequence(java.lang.String color)
      This will check to see if the userInput for the color is correct or not If it is, the game will continue, and if it's the last one in the sequence, it will add a new random color to the sequence.
      void endGame()
      This mutator method ends the game.
      int getIndex()
      This returns the index
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSequence()
      This is a getter method for the ArrayList
      boolean isGameOn()
      This returns the value of GameOn

      Sets the gameOn variable to a boolean
      void setIndex(int index)
      This is a setter method for the index.
      void setSequence(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sequence)
      This sets the sequence to a certain Array of colors.
      void start()
      This mutator method starts the game by generating a random sequence and setting GameOn to true.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimonSays

        public SimonSays()
        This is a constructor to create the SimonSays Object It sets the index to zero, creates arrayList for sequence, and sets GameOn to false.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This mutator method starts the game by generating a random sequence and setting GameOn to true.

      • checkSequence

        public boolean checkSequence(java.lang.String color)
        This will check to see if the userInput for the color is correct or not If it is, the game will continue, and if it's the last one in the sequence, it will add a new random color to the sequence. If it is wrong, the game will end.
        Parameters:
        color - user input for the color they guess in accordance to the sequence
        Returns:
        true or false depending on if color is correct or not.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        This mutator method ends the game. It sets the game to false, index back to zero, and the ArrayList will clear.

      • addToSequence

        public void addToSequence()
        This mutator method will add a random color (r, g, y, b) to the sequence

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        This returns the index
        Returns:
        index

      • setIndex

        public void setIndex(int index)
        This is a setter method for the index.
        Parameters:
        index - This keeps track on which color we are checking

      • getSequence

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSequence()
        This is a getter method for the ArrayList
        Returns:
        sequence ArrayList that contains the sequence of colors.

      • setSequence

        public void setSequence(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sequence)
        This sets the sequence to a certain Array of colors.
        Parameters:
        sequence - array of colors

      • isGameOn

        public boolean isGameOn()
        This returns the value of GameOn
        Returns:
        true or false

      • setGameOn

        public void setGameOn(boolean gameOn)
        Sets the gameOn variable to a boolean
        Parameters:
        gameOn - this is a boolean value
